item.title: Steinmetz: “What Luther Got Wrong” about Aquinas
item.dc:creator: lo
item.description:
It would be too much to assume that Aquinas will ever be as central a theologian for Protestants as he has been for Catholics. But Protestants have begun to put an end to their own self-imposed impoverishment. They have opened the ranks of the theologians with whom they are in regular conversation to include Aquinas. …

Continue reading "Steinmetz: “What Luther Got Wrong” about Aquinas"
item.content:encoded:
It would be too much to assume that Aquinas will ever be as central a theologian for Protestants as he has been for Catholics. But Protestants have begun to put an end to their own self-imposed impoverishment. They have opened the ranks of the theologians with whom they are in regular conversation to include Aquinas. It is a development long overdue.

—Professor Emeritus David C. Steinmetz, “What Luther Got Wrong” (repr. from Christian Century, August 23, 2005, pp. 23, 25)
